doc.str: The culture chamber of the present invention has a fluid-filled culture compartment in which cells, tissues and other biologicals are cultured. The culture compartment is transversed by one or more molecular weight cut-off membranes attached to a membrane carrier assembly. Incoming nutrients are transported through the membrane into the culture compartment and metabolic waste products are transported away from the fluid-filled culture compartment through the membrane and out the chamber outlet. Both reusable and disposable culture chambers are described for culturing cells, cell aggregates, particles, tissues and organoids.

Verma, R. et al.; Antibody engineering: Comparison of bacterial, yeast, insect and mammalian expression systems, Journal of Immunological Methods, 216, 1998, pp. 165-181. cited by other . | Rai M. et al.; Expression systems for production of heterologous proteins, Current Science, vol. 80, No. 9, May 10, 2001, pp. 1121-1128. cited by other . | FiberCell Hollow Fiber Cell Culture Systems, Dec. 1, 2004 printout, Internet at bellcoglass.com. cited by other. | Hernaeus Instruments, Inc.; Genetic Engineering News, vol. 14, No. 12, Jun. 15, 1994. cited by other .
